Preserve leftover concentrate by freezing it in ice cube trays.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Ginger Beer Concentrate", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/04/ginger-beer-concentrate-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/04/ginger-beer-concentrate-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/04/ginger-beer-concentrate-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2013/04/ginger-beer-concentrate-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/ginger-beer-concentrate/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 &frac14; pounds fresh ginger, roughly peeled and chopped into 1-inch chunks", "2 cups filtered water, divided", "1 cup freshly squeezed lime juice (from 4 to 5 limes), plus more as garnish", "1 &frac14; to 1 &frac12; cups of agave nectar, honey or pure cane sugar (to taste, see note)", "club soda"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a blender or food processor, liquefy the ginger and 1 cup of water for 3 minutes. Strain the juice into a large bowl or pitcher. Transfer the ginger pulp back to to the blender or food processor, add another &frac12; cup of water, and liquefy again. Strain again, adding the liquid to the first batch. Again transfer the pulp along with another &frac12; cup water, liquefy again, and add to the liquid. Press on the solids with the back of a big spoon to squeeze out as much of the juice as you can.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/ginger-beer-concentrate/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Discard the mashed solids and rinse out your blender/food processor. Pour the liquid into the blender/food processor. Pour in the lime juice and 1 &frac14; cups sweetener. Blend for 30 seconds. To taste for sweetness, pour about 2 ounces ginger concentrate into a glass along with about 8 ounces of club soda. If it&#8217;s not sweet enough, blend in more sweetener until it reaches your preferred sweetness.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/ginger-beer-concentrate/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Refrigerate up to 3 weeks. Shake before serving. Add a squeeze of fresh lime to your ginger beer before serving. Fresh mint and/or candied ginger make nice garnishes as well.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/ginger-beer-concentrate/#instruction-step-3"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeYield": ["36", "36 oz"], "recipeCategory": "Beverages", "cookingMethod": "Food processor", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "71", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "2oz", "calories": "76 calories", "sugarContent": "11.2 g", "sodiumContent": "6 mg", "fatContent": "0.3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "0.1 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "18.4 g", "fiberContent": "0.7 g", "proteinContent": "0.6 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Allison Joanis"}, "datePublished": "2024-01-24", "reviewBody": "This is fantastic. I can upon this looking for natural flavoring options for my soda stream club soda and it\u2019s perfect for that\u2026even without a sweetener. One piece of advice, if you have a nut milk bag, use it!!!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Carol"}, "datePublished": "2024-02-01", "reviewBody": "I did step 1. Water and ginger. Nothing else because I want to use it in cooking and baking.  Put half in the freezer and half in the refrigerator. So far I\u2019ve only made tea. It is so good. 2 tablespoons ginger concentrate, 1 tablespoons honey and a little munkfruit to make the sweetness perfect for me. I love this stuff!  Hot. Cold. Great technique!  Thanks"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Chad Moore"}, "datePublished": "2024-02-06", "reviewBody": "It may sound funny but I was into beer making and had been using a muslin bag, but that was a 1x use only per round. Someone suggested a nylon paint strainer. Nylon is generally food safe as long as it doesn't stay in contact with warm food/liquid for prolonged periods. A short straining session should have no real plastic-to-food effects, so long as it's washed first with soap. I use the paint strainer to squeeze out the ginger pulp in making my ginger juice...it's way better than the collander and french press system I originally used. It also cuts the time down by a lot."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Lava"}, "datePublished": "2024-02-11", "reviewBody": "This is so yummy and surprisingly easy! I made half the batch with regular sugar and the other half with erythritol/monk fruit blend because I am watching sugar intake. Both taste amazing!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Jim"}, "datePublished": "2024-08-28", "reviewBody": "I'm from the UK and I've been on a Moscow Mule kick recently (pun intended), but good ginger beer here in the US is either hard to find, or very expensive, and often not that great.  It's either too sweet, or too bitter.\r\n\r\nI've been using the 'boil ginger and sugar together' then add water + yeast for the carbonation recipe for a while, but it takes so long between cooking and cooling, it's messy, and it separates too quickly, meaning you have to gently shake it all the time before use, losing a lot of the carbonation.\r\n\r\nWhile I did change some things, this recipe came out excellent.  \r\n\r\nFirst, I only used about 1/2lb of fresh ginger, chopped it into cubes, but didn't bother peeling as it's a pain in the arse to peel, and the papery skin doesn't affect the taste (make sure you're using young ginger, not old dried-up stuff from the back of your fridge.)\r\n\r\nI added the chopped ginger and 1/2 cup of water to the blender, let it whizz for a minute or two, then in stage 2 of the recipe, I added another 1/2 cup of water with the pulp.  In stage 3, instead of adding more water, I put the already strained juice back in the blender with the solids, and let that rip for 30 seconds or so, then strained everything through a nut milk bag, which let me squeeze out all the remaining ginger juices from the pulp.\r\n\r\nI discarded the solids, rinsed the blender, added the strained juice back in along with 1 cup of Turbinado sugar, some lemon juice, a little bit of cayenne pepper to give it some extra kick, and some ground cloves to add warmth, blended for 30 seconds, then bottled it.  I ended up with about 20oz of syrup.\r\n\r\nUsing the ratio in the recipe (2oz syrup to 8oz club soda), it came out perfect!  I think squeezing out the pulp in the nut milk bag was the key to making it strong enough, but with only using less than half the amount of ginger root.\r\n\r\nThis will be my go-to recipe from now on!!  Thank you! Made with a simple combination of peanut butter, tomato paste and collard greens, this soup comes together quickly and would be a great weeknight meal. If you love spicy flavors like me, don't hesitate to use liberal amounts of ginger and garlic. Recipe yields 6 bowls.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "West African peanut soup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/west-african-peanut-soup-recipe-4-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/west-african-peanut-soup-recipe-4-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/west-african-peanut-soup-recipe-4-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/west-african-peanut-soup-recipe-4-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/west-african-peanut-soup/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "1 medium red onion, chopped", "1 medium jalapen\u0303o (optional, for heat), seeded, ribs removed, and finely chopped", "1 teaspoon fine salt, to taste", "2 tablespoons finely grated or minced fresh ginger", "4 medium cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth", "2 cups water", "\u00be cup creamy peanut butter*", "6 ounces tomato paste", "1 medium bunch collard greens or kale (about 8 ounces), tough ribs removed and leaves chopped into bite-size pieces", "Hot sauce, preferably Sriracha", "For serving (optional): 1 batch of cooked brown rice", "For garnish (optional):\u00a0 \u00bc cup roughly chopped roasted peanuts and a handful of chopped fresh cilantro"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a Dutch oven or soup pot, warm the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering. Add the onion, jalapen\u0303o (if using), and a dash of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the onions are translucent, about 5 to 8 minutes. Add the ginger, garlic, and salt. Cook, stirring frequently, until fragrant, about 1 minute.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/west-african-peanut-soup/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour in the vegetable broth and water, increase the heat to medium-high, and bring the mixture to a simmer. Cook for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally and reducing the heat as necessary to maintain a gentle simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/west-african-peanut-soup/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, in a heatproof medium bowl, combine the peanut butter and tomato paste. Transfer 1 to 2 cups of hot broth from the pot to the bowl. Whisk the mixture until smooth, then pour the peanut mixture into the soup and mix well.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/west-african-peanut-soup/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir the collard greens into the soup and continue cooking until the soup is nice and thick, with sufficiently softened greens, 15 to 25 minutes longer. Season the soup with hot sauce to taste (I usually add over 1 tablespoon Sriracha, but I like spicy soups). Remove the pot from the heat and add more salt to taste, if necessary (I often add up to \u00bd \u00a0teaspoon more).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/west-african-peanut-soup/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Serve the soup in bowls as desired\u2014perhaps over cooked rice, with a sprinkle of chopped peanuts and cilantro on top. I've made it SO many times. It's the weirdest combination with unlikely flavors, and it just works. I make a double batch often. \r\nIf you do make this, here's my pointers: Definitely add a can of chickpeas when you add the kale. Also, when cooking the red onion, also add a medium chopped sweet potato. Double those if making a double batch. Don't skip the chopped peanuts at the end and add a squeeze of lime. Serve over brown rice too. Omit the jalapeno unless you have a hankering for it because I've made it with and without and it adds nothing really IMO, except burning hands.  Lastly, do not use peanut butter with any ingredients except for peanuts and salt. Smuckers natural fits the bill just fine. I use a whole 16 oz jar when making a double batch. I got these suggestions from other comments and also some were right in the notes of the recipe. Thanks for this awesome recipe, Kate!"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Laurie"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-24", "reviewBody": "What a terrific soup. Add the onion, garlic, ginger and jalape\u00f1o, and cook until softened, stirring occasionally, about 4 to 6 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-dal-makhani-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the garam masala, cumin, coriander and salt. Season generously with black pepper. Cook, while stirring, for 1 minute.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-dal-makhani-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the tomatoes and cook for 1 more minute, while stirring. Add the lentils, kidney beans, water and bay leaf. Raise the heat to medium-high and bring the mixture to a simmer. Reduce the heat to medium-low and simmer\u00a0until the lentils are nice and tender, stirring occasionally, about 35 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-dal-makhani-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the bay leaf. Transfer 2 cups of the mixture (make sure to get some liquid with the lentils) to a blender. Securely fasten the lid. Blend until smooth, about 1 minute, being careful to avoid the hot steam rising from the blender lid.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-dal-makhani-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the blended mixture back to the pot and stir to combine. Add the lime juice and season to taste with salt (I usually add &frac12; teaspoon) and pepper. If you would like to temper the flavor and make the mixture even more creamy, stir in a splash of half-and-half or coconut milk, to taste.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-dal-makhani-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Serve in bowls, with chopped cilantro and a lime wedge on top. Gluten free, easily vegan (skip the cheese), and packs great for lunch. Recipe yields 4 medium servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/kale-quinoa-salad-recipe-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/kale-quinoa-salad-recipe-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/kale-quinoa-salad-recipe-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/01/kale-quinoa-salad-recipe-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mexican-kale-quinoa-salad/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup quinoa, rinsed in a fine-mesh colander", "2 cups water", "&frac12; cup pepitas (hulled pumpkin seeds)", "1 small bunch of curly green or Tuscan kale, tough ribs removed and chopped into small pieces (or about 3 cups roughly chopped baby spinach)", "Fine sea salt", "1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked black beans", "&frac12; cup thinly sliced green onions or finely chopped red onion", "&frac12; cup lightly packed chopped fresh cilantro", "&frac12; cup oil-packed sun-dried tomatoes, rinsed and chopped", "&#8531; cup crumbled feta cheese (optional)", "1 to 2 medium jalape\u00f1os, seeds and membranes removed, chopped", "&frac14; cup olive oil", "3 to 4 tablespoons fresh lime juice (about 2 medium limes)", "&frac34; teaspoon ground cumin", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To cook the quinoa: Combine the rinsed quinoa and the water in a medium saucepan. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium-high heat, then decrease the heat to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook until the quinoa has absorbed all of the water, about 15 minutes, reducing heat as time goes on to maintain a gentle simmer. Remove from heat, cover, and let the quinoa rest for 5 minutes, which gives it time to fluff up.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mexican-kale-quinoa-salad/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, toast the pepitas in a small skillet over medium heat, stirring frequently, until fragrant and making little popping noises, about 5 minutes. Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mexican-kale-quinoa-salad/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the chopped kale in a large serving bowl. Sprinkle it lightly with salt and massage it with your hands by scrunching up large handfuls at a time until it&#8217;s darker and more fragrant (this makes the kale more tasty and easier to eat). Add the cooked quinoa, toasted pepitas, drained beans, onions, cilantro, sun-dried tomatoes, feta (if using), and jalape\u00f1o(s). Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mexican-kale-quinoa-salad/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the dressing, combine the olive oil, 3 tablespoons of lime juice, the cumin and salt in a cup or jar. Whisk until blended. Pour all of the dressing over the salad and stir until the salad is evenly coated. Taste, and add another tablespoon of lime juice (I like this salad to be pretty zippy) and/or more salt, if necessary. For best flavor, let the salad rest for about 15 minutes before serving.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mexican-kale-quinoa-salad/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This salad keeps well, covered and chilled, for about 3 days. This foolproof recipe yields French toast that's fluffy, tender, lightly sweet and golden brown. This recipe yields 8 large or 12 medium slices of French toast (4 servings).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "French toast", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/best-french-toast-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/best-french-toast-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/best-french-toast-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/best-french-toast-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 medium loaf of bread* (about 16 ounces, see step 1)", "1 \u00bd cups whole milk**", "3 egg yolks", "2 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted", "2 tablespoons maple syrup or brown sugar", "1 tablespoon vanilla extract", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon\u00a0", "\u00bc teaspoon fine salt", "For serving: Maple syrup, butter, fresh berries or berry compote, whipped cream or Greek yogurt, sprinkle of powdered sugar&#8230;"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cut your bread into &frac34;-inch thick slices, to yield about 8 large or 12 medium slices of bread. If your bread is stale, move onto the next step. If your bread is fresh and soft, preheat the oven to 300 degrees Fahrenheit. Place the sliced bread onto a large, rimmed baking sheet lined with an oven-safe cooling rack (if you have one) and bake for 8 minutes. If the bread still feels soft and squishy on the bottom sides, flip them and bake for an additional 4 to 8 minutes. We&#8217;re aiming for &#8220;stale bread&#8221; texture, not crispy toast. Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Gently warm the milk in the microwave or in a saucepan on the stovetop, just until it&#8217;s warmer than room temperature (otherwise, the melted butter will clump on impact). Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Separate the yolks from three eggs, reserving the whites for another use if desired. In a medium mixing bowl, whisk the egg yolks until well blended. Add the warmed milk, melted butter, maple syrup, vanilla, cinnamon and salt, and whisk until blended. Pour the mixture into a 9 by 13-inch baking dish.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you&#8217;re using an electric skillet, preheat it to 350 degrees Fahrenheit now. Place the sliced bread in the egg mixture, working with one side at a time. Once the bottom sides have absorbed egg mixture to a depth of about &frac14;-inch, flip each slice and repeat for the other side. Transfer the soaked slices to your prepared baking sheet.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Whisk the egg mixture once again to redistribute the cinnamon. Repeat with the remaining slices, whisking the mixture between batches.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you are\u00a0not using an electric skillet, heat a skillet (ideally cast iron) or griddle over medium-low heat. You\u2019re ready to start cooking the bread once a drop of water sizzles on contact with the hot surface. Note that we will not be using any butter or cooking spray to cook the toast\u2014there&#8217;s enough butter in the batter already.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once your cooking surface is sufficiently preheated, start cooking! Gently transfer a slice(s) to the skillet and cook until the underside is nicely golden, about 3 to 4 minutes. Flip and repeat with the other side, then transfer the toast to a clean cooling rack or serving platter. As time goes on, dial the heat down if your toast becomes too golden on the outside before the inside cooks through. Repeat with remaining French toast (if you have extra bread and batter left, you could cook a few extra slices).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/french-toast-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Serve French toast on plates with desired garnishes. Your recipes are simply the best.\r\nMy dad cooked, ( pastry chef,) at a Boston Harbour restaurant at the end of the Great Depression.. Hudson Bay Baked Beans, French Toast, German Chocolate Cake, and Pumpkin Pie were their specialties; boasting a \" secret ingredient.\" It was a combo of freshly ground nutmeg and freshly ground pepper; very little nutmeg and a large, large pinch of pepper. Their scrambled eggs recipe:  6 whole eggs + 6 yolks, 12 tbl heavy cream, ( I use home made Organic Almond Cream,) + a squeeze of onion juice, and of course a generous pinch of pepper, prepared in a double boiler; the water must not touch the upper pot. When the mixture reaches a dull appearance beat with a hand egg beater producing light clouds of egg. Sorry, this is your gig; got carried away. Oddly, the nutmeg Pepper combo zips up deer meat roast, too. Homemade vinaigrette keeps well for 7 to 10 days. If your vinaigrette solidifies somewhat in the fridge, don&#8217;t worry about it\u2014real olive oil tends to do that. Simply let it rest at room temperature for 5 to 10 minutes or microwave very briefly (about 20 seconds) to liquify the olive oil again. It is easily made vegan and/or gluten free (see notes). Recipe yields 1 loaf.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Zucchini bread, whole grains, naturally sweetened, summer", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/06/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["Optional: &frac34; cup roughly chopped raw walnuts or pecans", "&#8531; cup melted coconut oil or extra-virgin olive oil*", "&frac12; cup honey or maple syrup", "2 eggs", "&frac12; cup milk of choice or water", "1 teaspoon baking soda", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon + more to swirl on top", "2 teaspoons vanilla extract", "&frac12; teaspoon fine-grain sea salt", "&frac14; teaspoon ground nutmeg", "1 &frac12; cups grated zucchini (you&#8217;ll need 1 small-to-medium zucchini, about 7 ounces\u2014gently squeeze out excess moisture over the sink before stirring it into the batter)", "1 &frac34; cups white whole wheat flour or regular whole wheat flour"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit. Grease a 9\u201d x 5\u201d loaf pan to prevent the bread from sticking. If you&#8217;ll be toasting the nuts, line a small, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy cleanup.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Toast the nuts: Once the oven has finished preheating, pour the chopped nuts onto your prepared baking sheet. Bake until the nuts are fragrant and toasted, about 5 minutes, stirring halfway.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large mixing bowl, combine the coconut oil and honey. Beat them with a whisk until they are combined. Add the eggs and beat well. (If your coconut oil solidifies on contact with cold ingredients, simply let the bowl rest in a warm place for a few minutes, like on top of your stove, or warm it for about 20 seconds in the microwave.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the milk, baking soda, cinnamon, vanilla, salt and nutmeg, and whisk to blend. Switch to a big spoon and stir in the zucchini (be sure to squeeze excess moisture out of the zucchini first). Add the flour and stir just until combined. Some lumps are ok! Gently fold in the toasted nuts now, if using.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter into your greased loaf pan and sprinkle lightly with additional cinnamon. If you&#8217;d like a pretty swirled effect, run the tip of a knife across the batter in a zig-zag pattern.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 55 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean and the center of the loaf springs back to the touch. Let the bread cool in the pan on a wire rack. Use a serrated knife to cut individual slices.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-zucchini-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "This bread is moist, so it will keep for just 2 to 3 days at room temperature. So delicious! It's vegan if you use maple syrup instead of honey. Recipe yields 9 servings (so quite a bit\u2014if you're serving just 4 people, I'd probably prepare just 1 pound of strawberries, and enjoy leftover shortcakes as though they are sweet biscuits).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/08/classic-strawberry-shortcake-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/08/classic-strawberry-shortcake-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/08/classic-strawberry-shortcake-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/08/classic-strawberry-shortcake.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthier-strawberry-shortcake-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 &frac12; cups white whole wheat flour or regular whole wheat flour", "2 &frac12; teaspoons baking powder", "&frac12; teaspoon fine-grain sea salt", "&frac12; teaspoon ground cinnamon", "1 &frac14; cups regular (full fat) coconut milk (from a well-shaken can at room temperature*), plus more for brushing on top", "&frac14; cup honey or maple syrup", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "1 tablespoon turbinado sugar (optional), for sprinkling on top", "1 can (14 ounces) regular (full fat) coconut milk or coconut cream, chilled for at least 12 hours", "1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "2 pounds fresh strawberries, hulled and sliced lengthwise, divided (reserve a few small, whole strawberries for garnishing, if you&#8217;d like)", "1 tablespoon honey or maple syrup"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 350 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper and set it aside. Whisk to blend, then pour the wet mixture in to the dry.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthier-strawberry-shortcake-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Mix with a big spoon until you have a cohesive dough. If the dough is sticky and unmanageable, let it rest for a few minutes\u2014if it&#8217;s still being difficult, add another tablespoon of flour and stir just until incorporated.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthier-strawberry-shortcake-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Lightly flour your work surface, and turn the dough over onto it. Then, press the dough into a square shape about 1&#8243; deep.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthier-strawberry-shortcake-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a sharp chef&#8217;s knife to slice the dough into 3 even columns and 3 even rows, to make 9 squares. Place the squares onto your prepared baking sheet, leaving a couple inches around each one. Brush the tops of the dough liberally with coconut milk, and sprinkle them with turbinado sugar, if using. Bake for 20 to 22 minutes, until they are firm to the touch.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthier-strawberry-shortcake-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, prepare the coconut whipped cream: Open the can of chilled coconut milk or coconut cream, and scoop the solid white portion into your chilled bowl, leaving the watery part behind. With an electric hand mixer, beat until smooth and relatively fluffy. Add the honey and vanilla extract and blend to combine. If you want to make them extra decadent, add one more dollop of whipped cream and maybe a small strawberry on top. Toss the cauliflower florets with the olive oil, red pepper flakes and salt, and arrange it in an even layer across the pan. Roast for 25 to 35 minutes, tossing halfway, until the cauliflower is tender and deeply golden on the edges.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-cauliflower-and-farro-salad-with-feta-and-avocado/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To cook the farro: In a medium saucepan, combine the rinsed farro with at least three cups water (enough water to cover the farro by a couple of inches). Bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to a gentle simmer, and cook until the farro is tender to the bite but still pleasantly chewy. (Pearled farro will take around 15 minutes; unprocessed farro will take 25 to 40 minutes.) Drain off the excess water and mix in the olive oil, garlic and salt. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-cauliflower-and-farro-salad-with-feta-and-avocado/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large serving bowl, toss together the roasted cauliflower, cooked farro, olives, sun-dried tomatoes, feta and lemon juice. These delicious hash browns are lighter and healthier than greasy diner hash browns, since they're made with olive oil. Recipe yields 4 servings; you can double or triple this recipe but cook in batches as written below.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "hash browns", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/02/crispy-hash-browns-recipe-1-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/02/crispy-hash-browns-recipe-1-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/02/crispy-hash-browns-recipe-1-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/02/crispy-hash-browns-recipe-1-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 pound Russet potatoes (2 small-to-medium), peeled if desired", "&frac12; teaspoon salt", "&frac14; teaspoon garlic powder", "&frac14; teaspoon onion powder", "&frac14; cup extra-virgin olive oil"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scrub the potatoes clean and grate them on a large-holed cheese grater (I left the skin on, but you can peel it first if you\u2019d like). In a fine-mesh sieve, rinse the grated potato well until the water runs clear.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Drain the potatoes, and then place them potato on a clean tea towel or several paper towels. Twist the towel to remove as much moisture from the potatoes as possible (you might need to do this in two batches).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the grated potato to a bowl and toss it with the salt, garlic powder and onion powder.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large skillet (preferably cast iron, but non-stick works, too), warm the olive oil over medium heat until shimmering and a piece of grated potato sizzles on contact. Spread the potatoes over the skillet in an even layer and press them down with a spatula. Let them cook, undisturbed, for 2 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir again, press them down again, and cook for another 2 minutes. Repeat in 2-minute intervals, flipping in sections once they\u2019re crispy enough to do so, until the potatoes are golden brown and crispy, about 4 to 8 more minutes. Meanwhile, line a plate with a couple of layers of paper towels to absorb excess oil, and set it near the stove.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the hash browns to the lined plate and let them drain for a minute. (If you\u2019re making multiply batches of hash browns, repeat these steps as necessary\u2014keep in mind that your skillet will be really hot so your next batch may cook faster.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Season to taste with additional salt, if necessary, and serve hot.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/crispy-hash-browns-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT30M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Breakfast", "cookingMethod": "Stovetop", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "75", "ratingValue": "4.8"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 side serving", "calories": "211 calories", "sugarContent": "0.7 g", "sodiumContent": "296.6 mg", "fatContent": "14.1 g", "saturatedFatContent": "2 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "20.8 g", "fiberContent": "1.5 g", "proteinContent": "2.5 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dHash", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;6bMZwRGH&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;6bMZwRGH&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "2"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Kelly"}, "datePublished": "2019-11-25", "reviewBody": "Did not come out as desired"}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Julia"}, "datePublished": "2020-01-02", "reviewBody": "Thank you. And I had to cook in multiple batches and make occasional adjustments to the heat and timing, as you'd expect.\r\n\r\nThis may be just a matter of personal taste, but I found that rinsing the potatoes AND trying to squeeze every drop of moisture out of them made the hashbrowns too dry--they ended up more like a pile of tiny, distinct French fries. I got the crispy-outside-tender-inside, more patty-like hashbrowns when I rinsed the potatoes and only squeezed *most* of the moisture out, leaving a little bit behind to help them stick together during frying."}, {"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Paul Fitzgerald"}, "datePublished": "2023-06-15", "reviewBody": "Simply put, I will memorize this and never make hash browns any other way. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Easy Brown Rice Risotto with Mushrooms and Fresh Oregano", "description": "Creamy, delicious, healthier baked brown rice risotto with minimal stirring required! This recipe is designed for brown arborio/short grain brown rice so any grain substitutions will affect baking time. (White arborio rice will only need to be baked for 40 to 45 minutes.) Look for brown arborio/short-grain brown rice at well-stocked grocery stores or health food stores. Skip the wine if you don't drink, but it adds a lovely depth of flavor. Recipe yields 4 to 6 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "brown rice risotto", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/easy-brown-rice-risotto-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/easy-brown-rice-risotto-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/easy-brown-rice-risotto-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/08/easy-brown-rice-risotto-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-brown-rice-risotto-with-mushrooms-and-fresh-oregano/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons olive oil, divided", "1 small yellow onion, chopped", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "5 cups (40 ounces) vegetable broth, divided (if your broth comes in 32-ounce containers, feel free to avoid opening another container by substituting 1 cup water for 1 cup broth in step 3)", "1 &frac12; cups brown arborio/short-grain brown rice", "12 to 14 ounces sliced Cremini (baby portobello) mushrooms, debris rinsed from mushrooms and drained", "1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese", "&frac12; cup dry white wine, optional", "3 tablespoons unsalted butter, diced", "2 teaspoons tamari (for extra flavor, optional)*", "1 teaspoon sea salt, more to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "4 sprigs fresh oregano, leaves removed from stems and larger leaves torn into small pieces"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make sure your oven rack is in the middle position. Preheat oven to 375 degrees.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-brown-rice-risotto-with-mushrooms-and-fresh-oregano/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium Dutch oven over medium heat until shimmering. Add onion and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, for ten minutes, then add the minced garlic. Cook for another 2 to 4 minutes, until the onions are well browned.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-brown-rice-risotto-with-mushrooms-and-fresh-oregano/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add 4 cups broth (or 3 cups broth and 1 cup water), cover, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat and stir in the rice. Cover the pot and bake until rice is tender and cooked through, about 65 to 70 minutes. It will seem pretty dry when you take off the lid, but don&#8217;t worry!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-brown-rice-risotto-with-mushrooms-and-fresh-oregano/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "During the last 20 minutes of baking time, prepare the mushrooms. Warm 2 tablespoons olive oil in a large skillet until shimmering. Add the cleaned, sliced mushrooms to the pot with a dash of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms are darker in color, fragrant and have soaked up most of their own juices, about 13 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-brown-rice-risotto-with-mushrooms-and-fresh-oregano/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pot from the oven. Pour in the remaining cup of broth, the Parmesan, wine, butter, tamari, salt, and a generous amount of pepper. Stir vigorously for 2 to 3 minutes, until the rice is thick and creamy. Stir in the mushroom mixture and any remaining juices. Season to taste with salt and pepper, divide into bowls and top with a generous sprinkling of torn, fresh oregano leaves.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/easy-brown-rice-risotto-with-mushrooms-and-fresh-oregano/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT1H", "totalTime": "PT1H20M", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 to 6 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Main", "cookingMethod": "Baked", "recipeCuisine": "Italian", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "189", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "387 calories", "sugarContent": "4 g", "sodiumContent": "1299.7 mg", "fatContent": "21.2 g", "saturatedFatContent": "8.8 g", "transFatContent": "0.1 g", "carbohydrateContent": "41.6 g", "fiberContent": "3.7 g", "proteinContent": "13.1 g", "cholesterolContent": "34.4 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dEasy", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;lIMl95wj&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;lIMl95wj&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Crista Cheap"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-26", "reviewBody": "I made it with brown jasmine rice and it turned out great! Toss well, so that the sprouts are evenly coated in a thin layer of oil. Once the pan is hot, dump the sprouts into the pan and quickly rearrange them so the flat sides are face down. Let them cook for about two minutes, or until they are starting to brown on the bottom.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/quick-roasted-brussels-sprouts-coconut-ginger-sauce/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the pan to your broiler. The tamari almonds are a nice, crunchy touch. Be sure to season this soup with enough salt and lime juice so the flavors really sing. Recipe yields about 8 cups soup (4 servings).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/09/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 tablespoon coconut oil", "2 cups chopped yellow (sweet) onion", "2 cloves garlic, minced", "1 tablespoon minced fresh ginger", "2 tablespoons red curry paste", "4 cups low-sodium vegetable broth, plus more if needed", "&frac14; cup raw almond butter or peanut butter", "3 cups diced peeled carrots", "3 cups diced peeled sweet potatoes", "&frac12; teaspoon fine-grain sea salt, plus more to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper", "Up to &frac14; teaspoon cayenne pepper (optional, if you like spice)", "Minced fresh cilantro", "Fresh lime juice", "Roasted tamari almonds (optional, see below)", "&frac12; cup raw almonds, finely chopped", "1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon low-sodium tamari or coconut aminos"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large pot, melt the coconut oil over medium heat. Add the onion, garlic, and ginger and saut\u00e9 for 5 to 6 minutes, until the onion is translucent.", "name": "To make the soup", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the curry paste. In a small bowl, whisk together some of the broth with the almond butter until smooth. Add the mixture to the pot, along with the carrots, sweet potatoes, salt, and remaining vegetable broth. Stir until combined.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bring the soup to a low boil over medium-high heat and then reduce the heat to medium-low. Cover and simmer for 15 to 20 minutes, until the potatoes and carrots are fork-tender.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Ladle the soup carefully into a blender. You will likely have to do this in a couple of batches, depending on the size of your blender (never fill your blender past the maximum fill line). Being careful to avoid hot steam escaping from the lid, blend on low and slowly increase the speed until the soup is completely smooth. (Alternatively, you can use an immersion blender and blend the soup directly in the pot.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Taste, and season with salt and black pepper. If you&#8217;d like more spice, add a pinch or full &frac14; teaspoon cayenne pepper, and blend again. Transfer the soup back to the pot and reheat if necessary. If desired, you can thin the soup out with a bit more broth if it\u2019s too thick for your preference.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/thai-carrot-sweet-potato-soup-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Ladle the soup into bowls and top with minced cilantro, a squeeze of lime juice, and optional tamari almonds. I also used an immersion blender. Note:  if you use the IP, only use 1/2 of the stock/broth.\r\n\r\nI added a fresh cayenne pepper since my curry paste wasn't very hot.  I sauteed it with the onions and ginger. And then added the garlic last just until fragrant.  I didn't have red curry paste, so I used Panang, which was tasty.\r\nI did not use salt. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Healthy Banana Bread", "description": "With this healthy banana bread recipe, you're only a few simple ingredients away from the best banana bread ever! It's made with whole wheat flour and naturally sweetened with honey or maple syrup. You can easily make this banana bread vegan or gluten free\u2014check the recipe notes for details. Recipe yields 1 loaf (about 10 slices).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Banana bread", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/11/healthy-honey-whole-wheat-banana-bread-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/11/healthy-honey-whole-wheat-banana-bread-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/11/healthy-honey-whole-wheat-banana-bread-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/11/healthy-honey-whole-wheat-banana-bread-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-banana-bread-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["&#8531; cup (75 grams) melted coconut oil or extra-virgin olive oil or high quality vegetable oil*", "&frac12; cup\u00a0honey (168 grams) or maple syrup (155 grams)", "2 eggs", "1 cup (225 grams) mashed ripe bananas (about 2 &frac12; medium or 2 large bananas)", "&frac14; cup (56 grams) milk of choice or water", "1 teaspoon baking soda (NOT baking powder; they aren&#8217;t the same!)", "1 teaspoon vanilla extract", "&frac12; teaspoon salt", "&frac12; teaspoon ground cinnamon, plus more to swirl on top", "1 &frac34; cups (220 grams) white whole wheat flour or regular whole wheat flour**", "Totally optional: &frac12; cup mix-ins like chopped walnuts or pecans, chocolate chips, raisins, chopped dried fruit, fresh banana slices&#8230;"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 325 degrees Fahrenheit (165 degrees Celsius) and grease a 9\u00d75-inch loaf pan.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-banana-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large bowl, beat the oil and honey together with a whisk. Add the eggs and beat well, then whisk in the mashed bananas and milk. (If your coconut oil solidifies on contact with cold ingredients, simply let the bowl rest in a warm place for a few minutes, like on top of your stove, or warm it for about 10 seconds in the microwave.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-banana-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the baking soda, vanilla, salt and cinnamon, and whisk to blend. Lastly, switch to a big spoon and stir in the flour, just until combined. Some lumps are ok! If you&#8217;re adding any additional mix-ins, gently fold them in now.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-banana-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the batter into your greased loaf pan and sprinkle lightly with cinnamon. If you&#8217;d like a pretty swirled effect, run the tip of a knife across the batter in a zig-zag pattern.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-banana-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake for 55 to 60 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean (typically, if I haven&#8217;t added any mix-ins, my bread is done at 55 minutes; if I have added mix-ins, it needs closer to 60 minutes). Let the bread cool in the loaf pan for at least 10 minutes. You may need to run a butter knife around the edges to loosen the bread from the pan. Carefully transfer the loaf to a wire rack to cool before slicing.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/healthy-banana-bread-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT55M", "totalTime": "PT1H5M", "recipeYield": ["1", "1 loaf"], "recipeCategory": "Quick Bread", "cookingMethod": "Baked", "recipeCuisine": "American", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "3050", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1 slice", "calories": "233 calories", "sugarContent": "18 g", "sodiumContent": "260.6 mg", "fatContent": "8.9 g", "saturatedFatContent": "6.5 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "36.3 g", "fiberContent": "3.1 g", "proteinContent": "4.6 g", "cholesterolContent": "37.7 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dHealthy", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;0G3Jk7MG&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;0G3Jk7MG&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Joe Templin"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-04", "reviewBody": "This was delicious. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-beets-labneh-side-dish/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Scrub and trim the beets and slice them into wedges (about &frac12; to &frac34;-inch thick on the widest edge). Toss the beets and shallots with the olive oil and season with the red pepper flakes (go easy on the flakes if you&#8217;re sensitive to spice), salt and pepper. Transfer the seasoned beets and shallots to the prepared baking sheet (it&#8217;s ok if they overlap) and roast for 40 to 50 minutes, until fork tender. Bring the water to a boil, then reduce heat to a gentle simmer, and cook until the farro is tender to the bite but still pleasantly chewy. (Pearled farro will take around 15 minutes, unprocessed farro will take 25 to 40 minutes.) Drain off the excess water and mix in the olive oil, garlic and salt. Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mason-jar-chickpea-farro-and-greens-salad/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the dressing: Whisk together all of the dressing ingredients until emulsified.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/mason-jar-chickpea-farro-and-greens-salad/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Make the chickpea and celery salad: In a serving bowl, toss together the chickpeas, prepared celery, red onion and parsley. Top with cooled farro, then greens (leave about an inch of room at the top). It's just right\u2014cheesy and creamy but not too rich, with subtle roasted butternut squash flavor. To help this recipe come together quickly for a weeknight dinner, roast the squash in advance. If you choose a large squash, you'll have about twice as much as you need\u2014freeze it for future use. Recipe yields 8 servings (quite a lot!) and leftovers are great.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "butternut squash mac and cheese, healthy mac and cheese, mac and cheese with vegetables", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/01/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese-in-pot-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/01/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese-in-pot-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/01/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese-in-pot-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2023/01/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese-in-pot.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 medium to large butternut squash (1.5 pounds or larger), halved", "1 teaspoon extra virgin olive oil", "2 tablespoons unsalted butter", "1 teaspoon garlic powder", "1 teaspoon onion powder", "1 pound short-cut pasta (pipe regate, macaroni noodles, casarecce, cavatelli, fusilli)", "5 cups water", "1 teaspoon fine salt, to taste", "4 ounces cream cheese, cubed\u00a0", "8 ounces shredded sharp cheddar cheese", "&frac12; cup (2 ounces) finely grated Parmesan cheese, plus more for serving"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To roast the squash: Preheat the oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for easy clean-up. Scoop out the squash seeds with a spoon (we won&#8217;t need them for this recipe). Rub the olive oil over the cut sides of butternut, then place them on the prepared pan, flat sides down.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Bake until the squash flesh is easily pierced through with a fork, about 40 to 60 minutes. Once it&#8217;s cool enough to handle, peel off the skin and discard it. Use a potato masher to mash up the squash\u2014don&#8217;t worry about getting it perfectly smooth. You&#8217;ll need about 2 cups mashed squash for this recipe (you&#8217;ll likely have plenty extra, which you can freeze for future mac and cheese). Set aside, refrigerate and/or freeze the squash until ready to use.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the mac and cheese: Melt the butter in a large pot or Dutch oven over medium heat. Add the garlic and onion powder and cook for 2 to 4 minutes, stirring often, until the butter is fragrant and you see little brown flecks forming in the pan. Add the dry pasta and gently toss to coat it in butter.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour in the water and salt. Add 2 cups of the mashed butternut squash. Cover the pot and bring it to a boil over high heat. Once boiling, remove the lid and set the timer for 8 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cook, stirring occasionally, until the timer goes off. Do not drain the water. Stir in the cream cheese. Cook until the cream cheese has melted and the pasta is al dente (careful when you taste, it\u2019s quite hot), about 4 to 5 more minutes. Turn down the heat as necessary to avoid scorching but maintain a steady simmer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Reduce the heat to low. Add the cheddar and Parmesan, and stir until the mixture is melted and creamy. Remove the pot from the heat.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Season with salt, to taste (I usually add \u00bc teaspoon more). Serve the pasta in bowls with extra Parmesan grated on top, if desired. Leftovers keep well, covered and refrigerated, for up to 5 days.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/butternut-squash-mac-and-cheese/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "cookTime": "PT1H", "totalTime": "PT1H15M", "recipeYield": ["8", "8 servings"], "recipeCategory": "Pasta", "cookingMethod": "Stovetop", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "156", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "457 calories", "sugarContent": "3.3 g", "sodiumContent": "651.3 mg", "fatContent": "20.6 g", "saturatedFatContent": "11.5 g", "transFatContent": "0.3 g", "carbohydrateContent": "50.1 g", "fiberContent": "3.5 g", "proteinContent": "18 g", "cholesterolContent": "55.1 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "video": {"@context": "http://schema.org", "@type": "VideoObject", "name": "\u201dButternut", "description": "\u201dWatch", "contentUrl": "https://content.jwplatform.com/videos/&rdquo;fqao8kff&rdquo;.mp4", "thumbnailUrl": ["https://content.jwplatform.com/thumbs/&rdquo;fqao8kff&rdquo;-720.jpg"], "uploadDate": "1970-01-01T00:00:00+00:00"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Christine Barnes"}, "datePublished": "2025-10-28", "reviewBody": "So as Im reading the recipe I get to the part where it says boil the Mac with squash and water but dont drain, I was instantly like no this is not going to work. Recipe yields 4 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/simple-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls-2-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/simple-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls-2-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/simple-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls-2-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2015/01/simple-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls-2.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons extra-virgin olive oil", "1 &frac12; cups long grain brown rice", "3 cups vegetable broth", "1 &frac12; cup baby spinach, lightly packed", "&frac12; cup cilantro (mostly leaves, stems are ok), lightly packed", "1 jalape\u00f1o or serrano pepper, seeded, membranes removed and roughly chopped", "1 medium shallot, peeled and roughly chopped", "1 garlic clove, peeled, roughly chopped", "&frac14; teaspoon fine salt, more to taste", "2 pounds sweet potatoes (3 to 4 medium sweet potatoes), peeled and sliced into 1-inch chunks", "2 tablespoons olive oil", "&frac12; teaspoon smoked paprika", "&frac14; teaspoon fine salt", "2 cans (14 ounces each) black beans or 3 cups cooked black beans, with their cooking liquid", "2 teaspoons ground cumin", "&frac12; teaspoon chili powder", "1 teaspoon sherry vinegar or lime juice", "Fine salt and freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "&frac14; cup pepitas (green pumpkin seeds)", "&frac14; teaspoon olive oil", "1 avocado, pitted and sliced", "Jarred mild salsa verde", "Chopped cilantro", "Crumbled feta (optional, not vegan)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Line one large, rimmed baking sheet and one smaller sheet with parchment paper. Place the spinach, cilantro, jalape\u00f1o, shallot, garlic, salt and &frac12; cup of the vegetable broth in a food processor or blender. Blend until smooth.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat the oil in a heavy-bottomed pot over medium heat until shimmering. Add the rice and stir to coat. Spread the rice in an even layer on the bottom of the pot and let the rice lightly brown. This happens quickly! When the rice starts to brown, stir it and spread it out in an even layer again so that more of the rice browns.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "When most of the rice has lightly browned, scrape the green pur\u00e9e into the rice. Stir until the rice is evenly coated with green pur\u00e9e and continue to cook, stirring constantly, for a minute. Add the rest of the vegetable broth to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce the heat to a low simmer and cover the pot. Cook the rice on a very low simmer until tender, 35 to 40 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the rice cooks, toss the sweet potatoes in the olive oil, smoked paprika and salt until the sweet potatoes are evenly coated in oil. Arrange in a single layer on your prepared baking sheet. Bake for 35 to 40 minutes, tossing halfway, until the sweet potatoes are tender and caramelizing at the edges.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, transfer the beans and their cooking liquid (don&#8217;t drain the beans) to a medium pot. Stir in the cumin and chili powder and warm over medium heat. Once the beans are simmering, cover the beans and reduce heat to maintain a very gentle simmer until you&#8217;re ready to serve.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the rice is done cooking, remove the pot from heat. Uncover the pot and place a clean tea towel over the pot, then recover. The towel will help absorb excess liquid as the rice continues to cook in its own steam. (If you don&#8217;t have a clean towel, you can skip this step, just cover normally.) Let sit for 10 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once the sweet potatoes are done cooking, toss the pepitas with &frac14; teaspoon olive oil and a sprinkle of salt on the small baking sheet. Toast the seeds in the oven for 4 to 5 minutes, until they&#8217;re turning lightly golden and making little popping noises. Set aside to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-sweet-potato-green-rice-burrito-bowls/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Fluff the rice with a fork and season with salt if necessary. Recipe yields 3 to 4 meal-sized salads.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "kale panzanella", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella-5-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella-5-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella-5-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/10/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella-5.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 medium butternut squash (about 2 pounds), peeled and sliced into &frac34;-inch cubes", "1 to 2 tablespoons olive oil", "Salt and freshly ground pepper", "1 small loaf (about &frac12; pound) crusty whole grain bread, sliced into 1-inch cubes", "4 tablespoons seeds, such as pepitas (pumpkin seeds), sesame seeds and/or sunflower seeds", "2 tablespoons olive oil", "&frac14; teaspoon salt", "&frac14; cup olive oil", "1 tablespoon plus 1 teaspoon balsamic vinegar", "2 teaspoons maple syrup or honey", "1 teaspoon Dijon mustard", "&#8539; teaspoon salt", "Freshly ground pepper, to taste", "1 large bunch of Tuscan kale or regular curly kale, ribs removed and chopped into small, bite-sized pieces", "&#8532; cup grated Pecorino Romano or Parmesan cheese", "&frac12; cup dried cranberries", "1 medium shallot (the whole bulb, papery skin removed), sliced super thin"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 420 degrees Fahrenheit with racks in the upper third and lower third of the oven. Line two rimmed baking sheets with parchment paper for easier cleanup (I used one large half-sheet for the butternut and a smaller quarter-sheet for the croutons).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roast the squash: On one of your lined baking sheets, toss the cubed butternut in enough olive oil to lightly coat all sides. Sprinkle with salt and pepper and arrange the butternut in a single layer. Roast on the lower third rack until the butternut is tender throughout and caramelized on the edges, about 35 to 40 minutes, tossing at the 20 minute mark when you add the croutons during step 4.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare the croutons: On your other baking sheet, combine the cubed bread with the seeds and salt. Drizzle on 2 tablespoons olive oil and toss to lightly coat the bread. Don&#8217;t worry about trying to get the seeds to stick to the bread, just try to make sure they&#8217;re lightly coated in oil. Arrange the mixture in a single layer so no croutons are on top of one another.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once you have tossed the butternut and placed it back on the lower rack, place the sheet of croutons on the upper rack. Toast the bread for 10 to 13 minutes, until the edges are golden. Remove the croutons from the oven and check the squash\u2014it will probably need 5 to 10 more minutes before the edges are caramelized. Once the butternut is done, remove the pan from the oven and set it aside to cool.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the vinaigrette: Whisk together all of the ingredients until emulsified.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the kale: Transfer the chopped kale to a big salad bowl. Sprinkle a small pinch of sea salt over the kale and massage the leaves with your hands by lightly scrunching big handfuls at a time, until the leaves are darker in color and fragrant, about 30 seconds.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Final assembly: Add the grated cheese, cranberries and shallot to the bowl. Drizzle enough dressing into the bowl to lightly coat the leaves (you might not need all of it), then toss to coat. Add the roasted butternut and croutons and gently toss to combine. Drizzle in extra dressing if the salad seems like it needs it. For best flavor, let the salad rest for 10 minutes before serving.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/balsamic-butternut-kale-cranberry-panzanella/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT20M", "cookTime": "PT40M", "totalTime": "PT1H", "recipeYield": ["4", "4 salads"], "recipeCategory": "Salad", "recipeCuisine": "Tuscan", "suitableForDiet": "VegetarianDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "19", "ratingValue": "5"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "511 calories", "sugarContent": "21.1 g", "sodiumContent": "562.7 mg", "fatContent": "35.3 g", "saturatedFatContent": "7.6 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "43.6 g", "fiberContent": "5.8 g", "proteinContent": "11.8 g", "cholesterolContent": "14.5 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Laz"}, "datePublished": "2023-01-17", "reviewBody": "I loved I love this salad! Chop the kale leaves into small, bite-sized pieces. Transfer the chopped kale to a big salad bowl. Sprinkle a small pinch of sea salt over the kale and massage the leaves with your hands by lightly scrunching big handfuls at a time, until the leaves are darker in color and fragrant.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/autumn-kale-salad-with-fennel-honeycrisp-and-goat-cheese/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the remaining salad ingredients: Chop the apple into small, bite-sized pieces. Use a chef&#8217;s knife or mandoline to slice the fennel as thin as possible. Transfer the prepared apple and fennel to the salad bowl. Use a fork to crumble the goat cheese over the salad. Roughly chop the cranberries and add them to the bowl.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/autumn-kale-salad-with-fennel-honeycrisp-and-goat-cheese/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To toast the pepitas: In a skillet over medium-low heat, toast the nuts, tossing frequently, until fragrant and starting to make little popping noises, about 3 to 6 minutes. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Vegan Banana Nut Scones", "description": "Hearty banana pecan scones made with coconut oil and whole wheat flour.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegan-banana-nut-scones-with-maple-glaze-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegan-banana-nut-scones-with-maple-glaze-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegan-banana-nut-scones-with-maple-glaze-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/12/vegan-banana-nut-scones-with-maple-glaze-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 cup raw pecans or walnuts", "2 cups white whole wheat flour or regular whole wheat flour", "1 tablespoon baking powder", "1 teaspoon cinnamon", "&frac12; teaspoon ground ginger", "&frac12; teaspoon salt", "&#8531; cup solid coconut oil or 5 tablespoons cold butter", "&frac34; cup mashed ripe banana (about 2 medium bananas)", "&frac14; cup milk of choice (almond milk, low fat milk, etc.)", "2 tablespoons maple syrup or honey", "&frac12; teaspoon vanilla extract", "1 cup powdered sugar*", "&#8539; teaspoon fine grain sea salt", "1 tablespoon melted coconut oil or butter", "&frac12; teaspoon vanilla", "&frac14; cup maple syrup, add more if needed"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat oven to 425 degrees Fahrenheit. Place the nuts in a single layer on a rimmed baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Toast the nuts in the oven until fragrant, about 3 minutes. Chop the nuts into very fine pieces.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium mixing bowl, combine the flour, &frac34;ths of the chopped nuts, baking powder, cinnamon, ginger and salt in a bowl and whisk together.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Use a pastry cutter to cut the coconut oil or butter into the dry ingredients. If you don\u2019t have a pastry cutter, use a fork to cut the coconut oil into the flour, or use a knife to cut the butter into tiny pieces and mix it into the flour.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a liquid measuring cup, measure &frac34; cup mashed banana. Add milk until you have a total of 1 cup liquid. Pour in the maple syrup and vanilla extract, and mix well.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the banana mixture into the dry mixture and combine with a big spoon. At first it will seem like there isn\u2019t enough liquid to wet the dough, but keep mixing until you have thoroughly incorporated the wet and dry ingredients. If you must, use your hands to knead the last of the flour into the dough.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "On a flat surface (like a cutting board), form dough into a circle that\u2019s about an inch deep all around. Use a chef\u2019s knife to cut the circle into 8 even slices.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Separate slices and place on the baking sheet covered with parchment paper. Bake for 15 minutes to 17 or until lightly golden brown.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegan-banana-nut-scones/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the scones are baking, whisk together the glaze ingredients in a small bowl until smooth and creamy. (If you&#8217;re using coconut oil and it solidifies on contact with cold syrup, gently warm the glaze in the microwave or on the stove, then mix again.) Let the scones cool for a few minutes, then drizzle the glaze generously over the scones. This recipe is easy to make with wholesome pantry ingredients, and it's naturally sweetened with honey instead of corn syrup. Keep in mind that these no-bake treats require 2 hours in the refrigerator to set. Recipe yields 16 small treats from one 8-inch square pan (or double the recipe to fill a 9 by 13-inch pan).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "scotcheroos without corn syrup", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2020/03/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 cups brown rice crisps*", "1 &frac14; cups whole pecans, chopped, divided", "\u00be cup creamy peanut butter (plus a pinch of salt if your peanut butter is unsalted)", "\u00bd cup honey", "1 \u00bd cups (9 ounces) chocolate chips*", "&frac12; teaspoon flaky sea salt or &frac14; teaspoon kosher salt"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line an 8-inch square baking dish with a strip of parchment paper, cut to fit neatly across the base and up opposite sides. In a large mixing bowl, combine the brown rice crisps and 1 cup of the chopped pecans (reserve the rest for sprinkling on top). Set both aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium saucepan, combine the peanut butter and honey. Warm the mixture over medium-low heat, stirring often, until it&#8217;s steaming or you catch a bubble or two forming on the bottom, about 5 minutes. (We don&#8217;t want this mixture to come to a boil or the peanut butter could scorch.)\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the warm mixture into the bowl of rice crisps. Using a rubber or silicone spatula, stir until the mixture is completely combined. Transfer it all to the lined baking dish. Press down with the spatula to spread it fairly evenly, then switch to a large, sturdy glass with a flat bottom (maybe a working jar or mason jar or what-have-you) and press down firmly all over, including the corners. You really want to pack it down (it&#8217;s ok if you hear some crunching noises). Lastly, use your hands to ensure that it&#8217;s evenly compacted.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the chocolate chips in a microwave-safe bowl in 30-second increments, stirring after each one. Don\u2019t overdo it. The chocolate is done when it\u2019s about 90% melted\u2014keep stirring off the heat and the pieces should completely dissolve. (Alternately, you can use melt it in a heat-proof bowl set over a saucepan of gently simmering water.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the melted chocolate over the peanut butter-crispy mixture. Use a clean spatula to spread it evenly all over. Make some pretty chocolate swooshes if you&#8217;d like. Sprinkle the remaining pecans on top, followed by the salt.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the baking dish in the refrigerator and chill for at least 2 hours, or up to a day. To slice, carefully grab both sides of the parchment paper and lift it out of the baking dish. Use a sharp chef&#8217;s knife to make 4 even columns and 4 even rows\u2014to minimize the risk of cracking the chocolate, carefully apply even pressure from above the knife to press straight down, rather than sawing from one edge across.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "These bars will keep well at room temperature for up to 1 week, or for several months in the freezer. Store in an air-tight container either way.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/chocolate-peanut-butter-crispy-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}], "prepTime": "PT10M", "cookTime": "PT10M", "totalTime": "PT20M", "recipeYield": ["16", "16 treats"], "recipeCategory": "Dessert", "cookingMethod": "No Bake", "recipeCuisine": "American", "suitableForDiet": "GlutenFreeDiet", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "71", "ratingValue": "4.9"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": null, "calories": "258 calories", "sugarContent": "19.6 g", "sodiumContent": "118.8 mg", "fatContent": "16.5 g", "saturatedFatContent": "4.6 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "27.4 g", "fiberContent": "2.7 g", "proteinContent": "4.9 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "H"}, "datePublished": "2025-01-05", "reviewBody": "I have made these for years and they\u2019re always a hit! Peanut butter is our favorite, but sunbutter and almond mixed is our favorite for school. \r\n\r\nI feel that maple syrup always makes the rice cereal get less crispy, so we stick with honey these days. \r\n\r\nGotta have coarse salt on top!\r\n\r\nThanks Kate for this recipe!
