Add the salt, bring the water to a boil, then reduce the heat to maintain a gentle simmer. Cook until the farro is tender to the bite but still pleasantly chewy. (Pearled farro will take around 15 minutes; unprocessed farro will take 25 to 40 minutes.) Drain off the excess water and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/farro-kale-goat-cheese-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, place the chopped kale in a large serving bowl. Sprinkle it with a few dashes of salt and massage it with your hands by scrunching up large handfuls at a time until it&#8217;s darker and more fragrant (this makes the kale taste less bitter and makes it easier to eat). Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/farro-kale-goat-cheese-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To toast the almonds, pour them into a small skillet. Cook over medium heat, stirring frequently (careful, they can burn), until the almonds are fragrant and starting to turn golden on the edges, about 4 to 5 minutes. Pour the almonds into the bowl of massaged kale.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/farro-kale-goat-cheese-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the vinaigrette, simply whisk the ingredients together in a liquid measuring cup or small bowl. Taste, and if the salad doesn&#8217;t taste amazing yet, stir in more vinegar by the teaspoon until it does.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/farro-kale-goat-cheese-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Crumble the remaining goat cheese on top of the salad. Pour in the egg mixture and cook, stirring often, until the eggs are just set, about 2 to 4 minutes. Stir in the cheese and transfer the mixture to a bowl. Then stir in the cilantro and green onion (if you\u2019re serving the burritos right away, reserve a small amount of each for garnish).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-breakfast-burritos-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To make sure the tortillas are nice and pliable, quickly run each tortilla under running water (trust me). Warm the tortillas briefly in the microwave (about 10 to 20 seconds) or in a skillet.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-breakfast-burritos-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Working with one tortilla at a time, spread about &#8531; cup hash browns on a tortilla about one-third from the edge. Drizzle 1 tablespoon salsa on top of the hash browns. Top with about &#8531; cup scrambled eggs. (You can eyeball the amounts of hash browns and scrambled eggs; just try to divide them evenly between the tortillas.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-breakfast-burritos-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Roll up the burrito by first folding the tortilla over from the bottom to partially cover the contents, then fold in the two sides. Finish rolling and put the burrito seam side down on a plate. Repeat with the remaining burritos.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-breakfast-burritos-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you\u2019re serving the burritos right away: You can halve the burritos like I did, or serve them whole. Warm some extra salsa in the microwave or on the stove, then pour it over the burritos. Top with diced avocado (if using) and the reserved cilantro and green onion. Serve immediately, with a knife and a fork.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-breakfast-burritos-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you\u2019re freezing the burritos for later: Let the burritos cool to room temperature, then wrap each burrito in plastic wrap. Transfer the wrapped burritos to a freezer-safe bag and squeeze out the air before sealing. Store the burritos in the freezer. For best flavor, consume your burritos within 3 to 6 months.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/vegetarian-breakfast-burritos-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To defrost frozen burritos, unwrap the plastic wrap and then wrap the burrito in a damp paper towel. It\u2019s easy to make in a food processor. Recipe yields about 3 1/2 cups guacamole.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/05/kale-guacamole-3-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/05/kale-guacamole-3-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/05/kale-guacamole-3-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/05/kale-guacamole-3.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kale-guacamole-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 to 4 big leaves of curly green kale (the Tuscan/lacinato variety also works well)", "4 medium ripe avocados, halved and pitted", "3 to 4 tablespoons lime juice (about 1 &frac12; medium limes), divided, to taste", "&frac34; teaspoon kosher salt, to taste", "&#8531; cup roughly chopped red onion", "&frac14; cup roughly chopped fresh cilantro, lightly packed", "1 small jalape\u00f1o, seeds and membranes removed, roughly chopped"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare the kale, first remove the tough ribs with a chef\u2019s knife and discard them. Chop the kale into small, bite-sized pieces. Sprinkle it lightly with salt, followed by a squeeze of lime juice (about 1 teaspoon). Massage the kale by scrunching it up in your hands, repeating until the kale is darker green and fragrant (this step softens the kale and makes it less bitter). You\u2019ll need 1 cup (packed) kale for the guacamole, so measure it out and set it aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kale-guacamole-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Next, use a spoon to scoop the flesh of the avocados into the bowl of a food\u00a0processor, discarding any bruised, browned areas. Add 3 tablespoons lime juice and the salt. Blend until the mixture is fairly smooth, pausing to scrape down the sides as necessary.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kale-guacamole-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the massaged kale, onion, cilantro and\u00a0jalape\u00f1o. Blend until the mixture is mostly smooth, with only tiny bits of kale and onion remaining (or completely smooth, if you prefer). Taste, and add additional salt and/or lime juice, if necessary, and blend again (I usually add up to \u00bd teaspoon more salt and another tablespoon of lime juice). Serve immediately.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/kale-guacamole-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}], "prepTime": "PT15M", "totalTime": "PT15M", "recipeYield": ["3", "3 1/2 cups"], "recipeCategory": "Appetizer", "recipeCuisine": "Mexican", "aggregateRating": {"@type": "AggregateRating", "reviewCount": "10", "ratingValue": "5"}, "nutrition": {"servingSize": "1/2 cup", "calories": "218 calories", "sugarContent": "4.9 g", "sodiumContent": "256.1 mg", "fatContent": "17.6 g", "saturatedFatContent": "3.4 g", "transFatContent": "0 g", "carbohydrateContent": "15.8 g", "fiberContent": "10.2 g", "proteinContent": "4.3 g", "cholesterolContent": "0 mg", "@type": "nutritionInformation"}, "review": [{"@type": "Review", "reviewRating": {"@type": "Rating", "ratingValue": "5"}, "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Helena | Fried Parsley"}, "datePublished": "2016-05-18", "reviewBody": "I was so excited  to see this in my inbox, what a genius idea! It's creamy, dreamy and light. This hummus recipe is easy to make\u2014no peeling chickpeas or overnight soak required. Recipe yields about 2 cups.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "hummus, chickpeas, easy", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-hummus-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-hummus-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-hummus-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/05/best-hummus.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-hummus-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 can (15 ounces) chickpeas, rinsed and drained, or 1 &frac12; cups cooked chickpeas", "&frac12; teaspoon baking soda (if you&#8217;re using canned chickpeas)", "\u00bc cup lemon juice\u00a0(from 1 \u00bd to 2 lemons), more to taste", "1 medium-to-large clove garlic, roughly chopped", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt, to taste", "&frac12; cup tahini", "2 to 4 tablespoons ice water, more as needed", "&frac12; teaspoon ground cumin", "1 tablespoon extra-virgin\u00a0olive oil", "Any of the following garnishes:\u00a0 drizzle of olive oil or zhoug sauce, sprinkle of ground sumac or paprika, chopped fresh parsley"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the chickpeas in a medium saucepan and add the baking soda. Cover the chickpeas by several inches of water, then bring the mixture to a boil over high heat. Continue boiling, reducing heat if necessary to prevent overflow, for about 20 minutes, or until the chickpeas look bloated, their skins are falling off, and they&#8217;re quite soft. In a fine-mesh strainer, drain the chickpeas and run cool water over them for about 30 seconds. Set aside (no need to peel the chickpeas for this recipe!).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-hummus-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, in a food processor or high-powered blender, combine the lemon juice, garlic and salt. Process until the garlic is very finely chopped, then let the mixture rest so the garlic flavor can mellow, ideally 10 minutes or longer.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-hummus-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the tahini to the food processor and blend until the mixture is thick and creamy, stopping to scrape down any tahini stuck to the sides and bottom of the processor as necessary.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-hummus-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While running the food processor, drizzle in 2 tablespoons ice water. Scrape down the food processor, and blend until the mixture is ultra smooth, pale and creamy. (If your tahini was extra-thick to begin with, you might need to add 1 to 2 tablespoons more ice water.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-hummus-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add the cumin and the drained, over-cooked chickpeas to the food processor. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/tangy-lentil-salad-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Once your timer has gone off, use a fork to scoop out a few lentils and test for doneness (careful, they\u2019re hot). Your lentils are done when they are pleasantly tender throughout (not mushy or falling apart) and taste nicely earthy (undercooked lentils tend to taste somewhat metallic). If your lentils aren\u2019t fully cooked yet, retest every 1 to 2 minutes until they are. Store them in the freezer and you\u2019ll always have a wholesome snack ready when you need it. These bars require an hour-long rest in the refrigerator to set. Recipe yields 16 small (2-inch square) granola bars.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "pecan granola bars", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/07/pecan-pie-granola-bars-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/07/pecan-pie-granola-bars-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/07/pecan-pie-granola-bars-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2017/07/pecan-pie-granola-bars.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 &frac14; cups pecan halves (5 ounces)", "2 cups quick-cooking oats (or old-fashioned oats, pulsed briefly in a food processor or blender to break them up)", "1 teaspoon ground cinnamon", "\u00bd teaspoon fine sea salt (if using regular table salt or salted nut butter, scale back a bit)", "1 cup homemade pecan butter* or creamy almond butter or peanut butter", "\u00bd cup maple syrup or honey", "1 \u00bd teaspoons vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Line a 9-inch square baker with one strip of parchment paper, cut to fit neatly across the base. The parchment paper will make it easy for you to slice the bars later.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For maximum flavor, toast the pecans: In a medium skillet over medium heat, toast the pecans, stirring frequently (don\u2019t let them burn!), until they are nice and fragrant, about 4 to 7 minutes. Transfer them to a cutting board to cool. Set aside 16 of your prettiest pecan halves for garnish, then chop the rest. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a large mixing bowl, combine the oats, cinnamon, and salt, and stir to blend. Set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "If you have made pecan butter for this recipe*, add the maple syrup and vanilla to your food processor or blender and blend to combine. If not, in a 2-cup liquid measuring cup, measure out 1 cup nut butter. Top with \u00bd cup maple syrup, followed by the vanilla extract. Whisk until well blended. (If you must, you can gently warm the liquid mixture in the microwave or on the stovetop.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour the liquid ingredients into the dry ingredients. Use a big spoon to mix them together until the two are evenly combined and no dry oats remain. Add the chopped pecans and stir until they are evenly dispersed. The drier the mixture, the more firm the bars will be, so stir in extra oats if the mixture seems wet. Conversely, if you used a super thick nut butter, you might need to drizzle in another tablespoon of honey to help it all stick together.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the mixture to the prepared square baker. Use your spoon to arrange the mixture fairly evenly in the baker. Cover the bottom of a flat, round surface (like a short, sturdy drinking glass) with a strip of parchment paper (see photo) and pack the mixture down as firmly and evenly as possible. Press the reserved pecan halves into the surface to create 4 even rows and 4 even columns (see photo).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Cover the baker and refrigerate for at least one hour, or overnight. This gives the oats time to absorb moisture so the granola bars can set. When you\u2019re ready to slice, lift the bars out of the baker by grabbing both both ends of the parchment paper. Use a sharp chef\u2019s knife to slice the mixture into 4 even rows and 4 even columns (these \u201cbars\u201d stick together better in a square shape).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/pecan-granola-bars-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "For portability, you can wrap individual bars in plastic wrap or parchment paper. Cook, stirring frequently, until the spinach has wilted. Repeat with remaining spinach and cook until all of the spinach has wilted, about 3 minutes. Remove the skillet from the heat and set aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-vegetable-lasagna-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, to prepare the tomato sauce: Pour the tomatoes into a mesh sieve or fine colander and drain off the excess juice for a minute. Then, transfer the drained tomatoes to the bowl of a food processor. Add the basil, olive oil, garlic, salt, and red pepper flakes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-vegetable-lasagna-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pulse the mixture about 10 times, until the tomatoes have broken down to an easily spreadable consistency. Pour the mixture into a bowl for later (you should have a little over 2 cups sauce). Rinse out the food processor and return it to the machine.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-vegetable-lasagna-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Pour half of the cottage cheese (1 cup) into the processor and blend it until smooth, about 1 minute. Transfer the mixture to large mixing bowl. No need to rinse out the bowl of the food processor this time; just put it back onto the machine because you&#8217;ll need it later.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-vegetable-lasagna-recipe/#instruction-step-6"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Transfer the cooked veggies and spinach mixture to the bowl of the food processor. Pulse until they are more finely chopped (but not pur\u00e9ed!), about 5 to 7 times, stopping to scrape down the sides as necessary. Transfer the mixture to the bowl of whipped cottage cheese. Top with the remaining cottage cheese, then add &frac14; to &frac12; teaspoon salt (to taste) and lots of freshly ground black pepper. Stir to combine. Now it&#8217;s lasagna assembly time!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-vegetable-lasagna-recipe/#instruction-step-7"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Spread \u00bd cup tomato sauce evenly over the bottom of a 9\u201d by 9\u201d baking dish. Layer 3 lasagna noodles on top (snap off their ends to fit, and/or overlap their edges as necessary). Spread half of the cottage cheese mixture evenly over the noodles. Top with &frac34; cup tomato sauce, then sprinkle \u00bd cup shredded cheese on top.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-vegetable-lasagna-recipe/#instruction-step-8"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Top with 3 more noodles, followed by the remaining cottage cheese mixture (we&#8217;re skipping the tomato sauce in this layer.) Sprinkle \u00bd cup shredded cheese on top.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-vegetable-lasagna-recipe/#instruction-step-9"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Top with 3 more noodles, then spread &frac34; cup tomato sauce over the top (you may have a little sauce leftover) to evenly cover the noodles. Toss until they are evenly coated in olive oil, and no powdery spots from the garlic powder remain. You can just bake it all in the oven! Recipe yields 4 servings.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "baked risotto", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/01/butternut-risotto-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/01/butternut-risotto-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/01/butternut-risotto-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2016/01/butternut-risotto-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-risotto/", "recipeIngredient": ["3 tablespoons olive oil, divided", "1 small yellow onion, chopped", "2 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "4 cups (32 ounces) vegetable broth, divided", "1 cup water", "1 &frac12; cups brown arborio/short-grain brown rice", "1 small butternut squash (about 2 pounds), peeled and sliced into &frac12;\u201d cubes", "1 cup freshly grated Parmesan cheese* (about 2 &frac12; ounces)", "&frac12; cup dry white wine, optional", "3 tablespoons unsalted butter, diced", "1 teaspoon salt, more to taste", "Freshly ground black pepper, to taste", "Pinch red pepper flakes, to taste", "1 tablespoon extra-virgin olive oil", "16 to 20 fresh sage leaves, chopped (to yield about &frac14; cup chopped fresh sage)"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "To prepare: Place your oven racks in the lower third and upper third positions (we&#8217;re going to bake the risotto on the middle rack and roast the squash on the upper rack at the same time), then preheat oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Line a large, rimmed baking sheet with parchment paper for the butternut squash. Reserve 1 cup broth from your container and set it aside for when the risotto is out of the oven.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-risotto/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium-to-large Dutch oven over medium heat until shimmering. Add onion and a pinch of salt. Cook, stirring occasionally, until softened and turning translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook until the garlic is fragrant, 1 to 2 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-risotto/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Add 3 cups broth and 1 cup water, cover, and bring to a boil over medium-high heat. Remove from heat and stir in the rice. Cover the pot and bake on the lower rack until rice is tender and cooked through, about 65 to 70 minutes. It will seem pretty dry when you take off the lid, but don&#8217;t worry!", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-risotto/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Immediately after placing the pot of risotto in the oven, toss the cubed butternut with 2 tablespoons olive oil on your lined baking sheet. Sprinkle with salt and some freshly ground black pepper and arrange the butternut in a single layer on the pan. Roast on the upper rack until the butternut is fork tender and the edges are deeply caramelized, tossing halfway. This took 55 to 60 minutes for me, but start checking for doneness around 40 minutes.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-risotto/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "While the risotto and butternut are in the oven, fry the sage: Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil in a medium skillet over medium heat. Once the oil is shimmering, add the sage and toss to coat. Let the sage get darker green and crispy (but not brown) before transferring it to a plate covered with a paper towel. Sprinkle the fried sage lightly with salt and set it aside.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/roasted-butternut-squash-risotto/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Carefully remove the Dutch oven from the oven. Remove the lid and pour in the remaining cup of broth, the Parmesan, wine and butter. Stir vigorously for 2 to 3 minutes, until the rice is thick and creamy. Recipe yields about 4 1/2 cups, enough for 8 servings (the recipe is easily halved).", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "Mexican cheese dip, queso", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-queso-dip-recipe-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-queso-dip-recipe-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-queso-dip-recipe-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2021/05/mexican-queso-dip-recipe.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-queso-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["2 tablespoons unsalted butter", "1 medium jalape\u00f1o or 2 tablespoons drained jarred jalape\u00f1os (both optional)", "1 small-to-medium red onion, chopped\u00a0", "&frac12; teaspoon fine salt, divided", "3 cloves garlic, pressed or minced", "\u00be cup whole milk, more to thin if desired", "8 ounces cream cheese, cut into 1-inch cubes", "8 ounces mild cheddar cheese, shredded (about 2 cups)", "8 ounces Monterey Jack or pepper jack cheese, shredded (about 2 cups)", "1 cup quartered cherry tomatoes, diced ripe tomatoes or canned drained diced tomatoes", "Several dashes of your favorite hot sauce, such as Cholula", "2 tablespoons chopped cilantro", "Tortilla chips or warmed tortillas, for serving"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Before you get started, be sure that all of your ingredients are prepared and ready to go near the stove. For jarred jalape\u00f1os, just finely chop them.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-queso-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Melt the butter in a small-to-medium Dutch oven or large, deep skillet. Once the cheese has melted completely into the mixture, add the next handful, and so on until you have added all of the cheese.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-queso-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Stir in the tomatoes, hot sauce, cilantro, and remaining &frac14; teaspoon salt. Gently stir until the mixture is combined and the dip is smooth and creamy (if the mixture seems gloppy at all, you may actually need to increase the heat a bit here). If desired, thin the queso with up to &frac12; cup additional milk in &frac14;-cup increments, stirring after each until it is fully incorporated.\u00a0", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/best-queso-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Promptly remove the mixture from the heat (don&#8217;t leave the queso on the stove, or it may overcook). Put the carrots in a large bowl. Drizzle with the oil and maple syrup, sprinkle with the cumin, and toss until evenly coated. Transfer to the lined baking sheet, spreading them in a single layer. Season generously with coarse salt and pepper. Bake for about 30 to 40 minutes, until the carrots are fork-tender and browning.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/masala-lentil-salad-with-cumin-roasted-carrots/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Meanwhile, put the lentils in a pot and add water to cover by 3 to 4 inches. Bring the mixture to a boil, then lower the heat and simmer until tender, about 20-30 minutes.\u00a0Drain, rinse under cold\u00a0running water, then let drain\u00a0completely. (If you\u2019re using canned lentils, you can skip this step.)", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/masala-lentil-salad-with-cumin-roasted-carrots/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Put the carrots and lentils in a large bowl and let them cool for 10 minutes. This breakfast is easily vegan and gluten free (see notes). If you're making the coconut whipped cream, be sure to chill your coconut milk overnight, and place your mixing bowl in the freezer at least 30 minutes.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/02/toasted-oatmeal-with-strawberry-chia-jam-and-coconut-whipped-cream-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/02/toasted-oatmeal-with-strawberry-chia-jam-and-coconut-whipped-cream-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/02/toasted-oatmeal-with-strawberry-chia-jam-and-coconut-whipped-cream-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2014/02/toasted-oatmeal-with-strawberry-chia-jam-and-coconut-whipped-cream.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/toasted-oatmeal-strawberry-chia-jam-coconut-whipped-cream/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 bag (12 ounces) frozen organic strawberries or other berries*", "2 to 3 tablespoons honey, maple syrup or agave nectar", "1 tablespoon chia seeds", "1 to 2 tablespoons coconut oil or butter", "2 cups rolled oats", "1 &frac12; cups + 2 tablespoons water", "&frac12; cup milk of choice (I used light coconut milk)", "Generous pinch kosher or sea salt", "Pinch of ground cinnamon (optional)", "Pinch of ground ginger (optional)", "Optional mix-ins: flax seeds, shredded coconut, toasted nuts, etc.", "1 can (14 ounces) full fat coconut milk, chilled at least 10 hours (the coconut milk MUST be full fat and MUST be refrigerated for at least 10 hours. Put a mixing bowl in the freezer or refrigerator to chill while you&#8217;re at it.)", "1 tablespoon honey, maple syrup or agave nectar", "&frac12; teaspoon vanilla extract"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "The strawberry chia jam takes the longest to make, so let&#8217;s start with the jam: In a medium saucepan, combine the berries (no need to defrost if they are frozen) and sweetener. Cover and bring to a simmer over medium heat, stirring frequently. Cook with me!", "sameAs": ["https://cookieandkate.com/about/"]}, {"@context": "https://schema.org/", "@type": "Recipe", "name": "Naturally Sweetened Pecan Pie", "description": "This delicious pecan pie is sweetened with maple syrup! This pecan pie recipe doesn't use corn syrup or refined sugar, and it's so easy to make. Recipe yields one 9\" pie.", "author": {"@type": "Person", "name": "Cookie and Kate", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/about/"}, "keywords": "naturally sweetened pecan pie", "image": ["https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/11/maple-pecan-pie-recipe-1-225x225.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/11/maple-pecan-pie-recipe-1-260x195.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/11/maple-pecan-pie-recipe-1-320x180.jpg", "https://cookieandkate.com/images/2018/11/maple-pecan-pie-recipe-1.jpg"], "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/naturally-sweetened-pecan-pie-recipe/", "recipeIngredient": ["1 single-crust pie dough (I used this recipe)", "1 &frac34; cups pecan halves", "3 large eggs", "1 cup maple syrup", "2 tablespoons melted butter", "2 teaspoons vanilla extract", "Optional: 1 tablespoon bourbon", "&frac12; teaspoon fine sea salt", "Optional, for serving: vanilla ice cream or whipped cream"], "recipeInstructions": [{"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Prepare your pie dough as directed. On a floured work surface, roll the dough into a 14-inch circle and drape it across a 9-inch pie plate. Gently nestle the dough into the edges of the pan. With scissors or kitchen shears, trim around the edge so you have an even 1-inch overhang. Fold the overhang under itself to create a thick border that rests over the rim of the pan. Use a fork to press gently all around the perimeter for an easy starburst effect (see photos). Place the pie pan in the refrigerator to chill while you make the pie filling.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/naturally-sweetened-pecan-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-1"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Preheat the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit with racks in the middle of the oven and the lower third of the oven. Place the pecans on a large, rimmed baking sheet and bake them for 5 to 6 minutes, until fragrant. Set the pan aside to cool, for now.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/naturally-sweetened-pecan-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-2"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "In a medium mixing bowl, whisk the eggs until they are pale yellow. Add the maple syrup, melted butter, vanilla extract, optional bourbon, and salt. Whisk until well blended.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/naturally-sweetened-pecan-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-3"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Remove the pie pan from the refrigerator and arrange the toasted pecans evenly inside the pan. Whisk the maple syrup mixture once more, then drizzle all of it over the pecans.", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/naturally-sweetened-pecan-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-4"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Place the pie on the middle rack, and your empty baking sheet on the rack below to catch any potential drips. Bake for 40 to 50 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and the middle of the pie has puffed up (it will sink as it cools).", "url": "https://cookieandkate.com/naturally-sweetened-pecan-pie-recipe/#instruction-step-5"}, {"@type": "HowToStep", "text": "Let the pie cool on a wire rack for 1 hour.
